Jianyou (Andre) Wang

I am a 4th year CSE PhD student at UC San Diego, advised by Dr. Leon Bergen and Dr. Ramamohan Paturi. I am a student founding member of the Laboratory for Emerging Intelligence. I also received my CSE master degree from UC San Diego. Previously, I attended Duke University with a triple major in mathematics, statistics and computer science, advised by Dr. Vahid Tarokh and Dr. Cynthia Rudin. I graduated with the highest distinction from Duke's math department.

My primary interest is in language modeling. Currently, my work spans these areas: AI Scientist; Agentic Framework; Instruction-Following Information Retrieval; Long-Context Modeling; Benchmarking; Scientific Document Processing; Synthetic Data Theory and Techniques.

For more information about my work, please visit my research page.

News

  • June 2025: I completed my thesis proposal and advanced to candidacy.
